message.entry: This model contains a Simulink function call subsystem embedded in Stateflow. One such function is ''{0}'' contained in the chart ''{1}''. Such models cannot be saved in Simulink versions prior to R2008B when this feature was first introduced. This model will not work in the older version.

There was a problem setting the port names of the Simulink subsystem to match the names of the Stateflow function inputs/outputs. The names of inputs/outputs have therefore been adjusted to prevent name collisions with existing blocks inside the Simulink subsystem.
Please do not attempt to delete function call trigger ports in Function-call subsystems contained inside a Stateflow chart.
Action Port blocks cannot be removed from a Simulink state contained inside of a Stateflow chart.
For Simulink subsystems contained inside Stateflow charts, the port names have to be identifiers. Therefore, the name of the port ''{0}'' has been changed to ''{1}''.
One or more non-contiguous output ports found inside a Simulink function in a Stateflow chart. Stopping code generation.

The port numbers in the function call subsystem ''{0}'' have gaps. This is not allowed for function call subsystems inside a Stateflow chart. The next time this model is saved or updated, these gaps will be removed.
Please save the library before you attempt to copy a Simulink function. The Stateflow clipboard buffer has been flushed to prevent erroneous copies.
Please do not attempt to rename Simulink functions inside Stateflow using the Model Explorer or set_param. The only safe way to rename a Simulink function is using the Stateflow editor.
{0} requires port ''{2}'' to explicitly specify (not inherit) the values of the following properties: {3}.
Name mismatch
The two ports are not connected.
Expression ''{0}'' contains a non-ASCII character. Only ASCII characters are supported.
Expression ''{0}'' contains invalid index ''{1}{2}''. Use a single pair of parentheses.
The expression ''{0}'' contains both MATLAB-format index ''{1}'' and C-format index ''{2}''. Use a single index format.
Expression ''{0}'' contains invalid index ''{1}''. All indices must be integers in the range [0,2^31-1].

Input port ''{0}'' in {1} cannot be mapped to any input of the container chart {2} because it does not contain any input data with the same name. Fix it by creating an input data of this name in the container chart or by specifying a mapping for this port.

Output port ''{0}'' in {1} cannot be mapped to any output of the container chart {2} because it does not contain any output data with the same name. Fix it by creating an output data of this name in the container chart or by specifying a mapping for this port.

Port ''{0}'' in {1} cannot be mapped to any data or event in the container chart {2} because it does not contain a compatible data or event with the same name. Fix it by specifying a mapping for this symbol.
''{0}'' inside ''{1}'' cannot be mapped to ''{2}'' in ''{3}'' because their scopes are not compatible.

The expression ''{0}'' does not resolve to a valid mapping for symbol ''{1}''. Please fix this by specifying a valid mapping for this variable in the "Mappings" section of the properties of state {3}.

''{0}'' has a parameter ''{1}'' whose value is specified as ''{2}''. Non trivial parameter mappings are not allowed for parameters whose names clash with names of Simulink subsystem built-in parameters. To see a list of all built-in Simulink subsystem parameters, execute the command: fieldnames(get_param('built-in/subsystem','ObjectParameters'))
''{0}'' has a Data Store Memory data ''{1}'' whose value is specified as ''{2}''. For Data Store Memory data, only mappings consisting of a single data name are allowed.

The following tables list the mappings from the subsystem symbols (on the left) to the symbols in the main chart (on the right). For every subsystem symbol, the drop-down provides the list of available symbols which that subsystem symbol can map to.
Subsystem Symbol
Mappings...
{0} specifies a mapping to the main chart symbol {2} which has a continuous update method. This is not allowed.
Simulink based states are not allowed in Moore charts.
Simulink based states are not allowed in Simplified charts.
Simulink based state {0} is not allowed in a Discrete Event chart.
Simulink based states cannot be used in charts which have super step semantics enabled.
Create data with name ''{0}'' in the container chart.
Port named ''{0}'' is incompatible with Stateflow data of scope ''{1}''.

"Data ''{0}'' of {1} is indirectly mapped to ''{2}'' in {3}. Simulink based state data may only be mapped to data of the same type and scope. Data may not be indirectly mapped to bus or array elements."
